oai_dc:dc.dc:description: a discourse upon the degrees of understanding possessed by various animals (L II.-8. 882-892). Some animals have' thoughts' (or 'understanding') and can talk as people do. According to ||kabbo (see p.891v), some animals stand upright like a man does. (Much of this story has not been translated.) ...
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A discussion on the respective understanding and foolishnesses of various animals and some of their doings
